Undeniable #1

Undeniable

Madeline Sheehan

4.01
50,808 ratings5,039 reviews
Rate this book
Librarian Note: Alternate Cover Edition for 9781301741724.

***Warning*** (This book contains several aspects of the uglier side of life; it is not for everyone.)

The story of Deuce and Eva...

An undeniable connection that stands the test of time.

Unforgettable moments.

Love and pain and everything in between.

I was five years old when I met Deuce, he was twenty-three, and it was visiting day at Riker's Island. My father, Damon Fox or "Preacher", the President of the infamous "Silver Demon's" motorcycle club -mother chapter- in East Village, New York City, was doing a five-year stint for aggravated assault and battery with a deadly weapon. It was not the first time my father had been in prison and it wouldn't be the last. The Silver Demon's MC was a notorious group of criminals who lived by the code of the road and gave modern society and all it entailed a great big f**k you.

"Never forget the day Eva came bouncin' into my f**ked up life, shakin' pigtails, singin' Janis, wearin’ chucks and sharin' peanuts and straight up stole any decency I had left which wasn't a whole lot but she f**kin' took it and I've been hers ever since."

P.A. Lupton 
2 books · 419 followers
December 4, 2013

Well, I can’t say I wasn’t warned. I feel like I’m missing something. I scroll through the reviews and look at all the 5 star ratings and wonder if I read the same book. I can kind of see why people rate this book 5 star. It’s extremely emotional and sucks you into the story, there is a ton of conflict, and Deuce is the poster boy for bad boys. And we all know how women like their bad boys. But sadly, for me, it was too much.

You ever watch Jerry Springer? I’ve watched it, and I’m usually sitting there wondering why people love the show so much. You have these crazy losers (sorry, not really nice but true) up on stage, screaming at each other because one person slept with another person who has a baby with absolutely no idea who the father is. Well, add drugs, extreme violence, rape and organized crime to the mix and you have Undeniable. I’ve never ever had the urge to delve into the lives of the crazy, screwed up people who frequent Jerry’s show, so I don’t know why I did it now.

I think most people who read this story will either give it a 1 star rating or a 5 star rating, I doubt there will be much in between. It’s definitely a love or hate book. I was well on my way to a 5 star and then it all went to hell.

So, why did I give the book 1 star?

Eva.

I absolutely do not like Eva as a heroine. I like to connect with a heroine, and I definitely have to agree with at least some of their decisions. Well, to me Eva is one of the stupidest women I’ve ever read about. I actually do feel sorry for her being raised in the environment she was raised in. It’s disgusting that she grew up around drug dealing, whores and infidelity and then grows up and wants to raise her kids in the same exact environment. And I’m supposed to think that’s a sweet and happy epilogue? Not only do I dislike her for being a terrible mother, but I was so pissed at her when she gets raped by her almost-brother and then not only forgives him, but tells him she loves him and marries him. Huh? Who the hell does that? On top of that, she has no self-esteem. She walks in on Deuce multiple times while he’s having sex with another woman and she forgives him—forgives him and allows it to continue. I wonder if she realizes she’s a door mat. I guess though, she deserves it since she started sleeping with him while he’s married. It’s just not possible for me to connect with a woman like this, and why would I want to. And for the life of me, I can't figure out why all the men love her.

It's not just Eva, though. None of the characters in this book have a single redeeming quality between them. I am glad about one thing, though. I’m glad Deuce and Eva ended up together. They deserve each other. I’m sure they’ll live miserably ever after, raising the next generation of immoral, screwed up children.
    erotica-i-want-to-read

First of all let me apologize to you all because I wanted to write a very short review but I just. Can't. Do. It.

Granted, curiosity got the better of me AND I was feeling kind of adventurous. That's the reason I wanted to read Undeniable in the first place. Additionally, I thought "Why not reading something a little bit out of my comfort zone?" I'm talking about the cheating. That's usually not my cuppa.

Ms. Sheehan applied the term f@ck/f@cked/f@cking 505 times, so please bear with me because I'm going to use this lovely term rather often in my review of Undeniable. As a matter of fact, I think it's justified to stoop to a certain level now and then. Furthermore, I would like to encourage potential readers of Undeniable to read my spoilers. As far as I can judge it's very wise to be well-prepared before diving into this mess. Let's get started…


Dear Deuce,

Did you know that many readers said that Undeniable is similar to KA's Motorcycle Man? Would you like me to show you a nice visual?

KA's MM



Madeline Sheehan's Undeniable

I have to tell you that I find it quite amazing who had sex with whom, how many times they did the deed without catching an STD. Condoms, anyone? I suppose tough biker dudes and bitches are immune to Aids and other STDs. *cough* But the old ladies are not immune at getting pregnant.



Yup. Boom.

The KA factor
A little example:

"(…)You are too good and too sweet and a man like Chase didn't deserve a taste of that kind of beautiful!"

Does this sound familiar to you, Deuce? The more I read the more familiar sounded anything and everything of Undeniable. The voice and writing is very, very KA. As it is, the only big difference is the violence and the fact that every character is pretty much f@cked up. While KA's asshole-ish heroes have redeeming qualities, I can hardly see that happening in Undeniable. I'm sorry, Deuce, but I tell it as I see it. Hence, the truth hurts now and then.

Dude, I swear I knew what I had to expect when I started to read Undeniable. So, I'd say this whole mess didn't come as a shock. Then again, I really had to put all of my shortcomings and beliefs far away to be able to actually like your story. I'll be honest, I didn't enjoy it, I didn't love it either but I liked it quite a bit and I loved the ending. Wow, I loved to see your vulnerable and softer side. Additionally, there is something very positive about this story: an older, very hot and sexy man in his fifties. You. I'm a sucker for attractive older heroes. I know, I'm guilty as sin when I say that I want to see more of those older and very yummy heroes. *sigh* After going back and forth I rounded up to four stars because your story is an enthralling as well as intriguing read. It's raw, gritty and disturbing. Hence, it's a dark look at a lifestyle that is incredibly far away from my (cushioned) mainstream life.

Deuce, please read this paragraph:

I was not going to cry. Nope. Just because he wasn't the man I'd thought he was didn't mean I was going to cry. It was my own fault, putting him on some kind of pedestal when in reality he was just another biker, who lies, cheats, and steals and who can't resist slutty club ass.

Yup, I'm feelin' you, dude, you're pretty speechless right now, aren't you? Nope, do not defend yourself! I gave you something to think about and let's leave it at that.

There's an excessive amount of crudity, foul language, cheating, degradation of women, violence etc. And there is Hey, calm down, Deuce! It's true and there's no need to throw a fit.

I'm honest when I say that I have my issues with certain characters, however, first and foremost I have issues with your queen of hearts. Eva is an odd one. She is hysterical to no end (screaming, more screaming, lots of screaming, slapping, punching…you get the gist), kinda weak and needy. Yes, please, tell Eva to reel it in! In case you didn't know it yet, this book is filled with plenty of hysterical women…just saying. That said, I completely understand that someone who grew up with this lifestyle may think and act differently because their options are limited. But still…

There are three different types of men in this world. There are weak men; men who run and hide when life slaps them in the ass. Then there are men; men who have a backbone yet occasionally, when life slaps them in the ass, will rely on others. And then there are real men; men who don't cry or complain, who don't just have a backbone, they are the backbone. Men who make their own decisions and live with the consequences, who accept responsibility for their actions or words. Men who, when life slaps them in the ass, slap back and move on. Men who live hard and die even harder.

DISGUSTING,NASTY,REPULSIVE,ABOMINABLE,REVOLTING and .....I LOVE it!

Readers be prepared for one hell of a ride.

WARNING-Please be prepared for the worst because it's nearly impossible to get off once started!!But feel free to scream,rant,rave,....all you want.


PROLOGUE--

Mark Twain said,"The two most important days in your life is the day you were born and the day you find out why."
I don't remember the day I was born but I remember the day I found out why.
His name was Deuce.
He was my "why".
And this is our story.
It is not a pretty one.
Someparts of it are downright ugly.
But it's ours.
And because I believe everything happens for a reason,I wouldn't change a thing.

She is the daughter of Damon Fox, aka 'Preacher',who is the president of the Silver Demon MC (motor-cycle club).She was practically raised by all of the gang members,spoilt a lot and of course can wrap them around her little fingers.

He is the son of the earlier president of Hell's Horseman MC,and now himself is the president.

They are rival gangs.None of them will hesitate putting the other to ground.A momentary truce exists between them now.

He is Deuce and she is Eva.

This is their love story.

Just not a romantic,flowery or dreamy one.

This is a hard,bitter and raw one.

First meeting--

Eva is five.Her father is in prison.She has come with uncle Joe to visit him.They tell her to go and grab a snack.

And there,by the snack machines,shaking her butt and singing Summertime way out of tune,she meets him.

Deuce is twenty-three.He’s visiting his father too.The only difference,he hates his father.He has never known any kindness and love,until he meets her.

And thus their journey began.

Filled with pain, betrayal, sorrow, lust, jealousy, hypocrisy,.....

And LOVE!!


They meet again and again and again.....

They love again and again and again......

They lose each other again and again and again......

It’s FATE which pushes them together.It’s LOVE which binds them together and it’s HATE,LUST,BETRAYAL... which tears them apart.

"I was not going to cry. Nope. Just because he wasn't the man I'd thought he was didn't mean I was going to cry. It was my own fault, putting him on some kind of pedestal when in reality he was just another biker, who lies, cheats, and steals and who can't resist slutty club ass."

Yes,she has always put Deuce up in a pedestal and loved him.

But can she love the real man? The man who gives a whole new dimension to the word ‘asshole’?

"Son, you are a fuckin’ moron. You wanna know what I see? I see a girl who isn’t just a girl but a fuckin’ prize and why the fuck she chose an asshole like you to give that fuckin’ prize to I haven’t a fuckin’ clue. Stupid if you ask me."

Can Deuce realize this?Can he redeem himself once and for all?Or will it be too late?

There are other people who want to tear them apart.

Chase- Husband of Eva's best friend Kami.This manipulative sick bastard loves Eva.He wants her.And is ready to use every tactic to get Eva.

Frankie- He too loves Eva.Obsessively.Possessively.If he can't get her,no one else can.

The author has very cleverly put these two people with their own definitions of love next to Deuce.

As a reader,I was forced to ask-What is love??
Is it what Chase and Frankie feel for Eva?What kind of love is so cruel?Love is never cruel.Then how is their love different from Deuce's love?He too cheats ,lies and hurts Eva.

"There wasn't a name powerful enough to describe what he was feeling, to convey what was happening inside of him. It was beyond words, surpassed all emotions. It was living death."--Deuce when he saw Eva getting raped by Frankie,unable to help.

This is where all my questions were answered.

October 26, 2012
Oh. My. God

What the HELL did I just read??

This was compelling, emotionally exhausting and yet strangely uplifting – this book is mad, it’s all kinds of wrong and yet, oh my God, I just totally DEVOURED it! It grabbed me by the throat right at the beginning, dragged me through the story barely allowing me to breathe and threw me in a heap at the end twitching, barely lifeless. This book OWNED me and it really shouldn’t have. The heroes are JERKS, the women don’t behave much better and yet I was compelled to keep reading, I lost sleep, I didn’t care – I just had to finish it!!

So, this is the story of Eva and Deuce and, unusually for contemporary romance, their story spans several decades. They first meet when Eva is 5 and Deuce is 23, both visiting their fathers in prison. Eva’s father is the president of an MC and Deuce is about to inherit that role of a rival MC when his father dies. Right from the getgo, Eva is in love with Deuce and she has caught his eye. They meet sporadically over the years until Eva is 16, Deuce, 34 and they become intimate and he eventually takes her virginity at 18 – I mentioned the wrongness right?

This is set in the badass world of Motorcycle Clubs and it’s raw, rough, edgy to say the very least as the story absolutely hurtles along like a runaway train out of control. It practically pulsates with an energy, a lifeforce of its own. Deuce behaves like a jerk to Eva for nearly all the book but true love is undeniable and, despite everything that goes down and boy does it go down, their feelings for one another completely outweigh time and everything that happens.

Deuce is such a badass and he is a jerk with a big old capital J – I hated the way he treated women, the way he spoke to them but yet still I LOVED him – what the heck is wrong with me? I’ve decided that Madeline Sheehan has managed to lace the pages with some kind of twisted magic that sucks you in, reaches in through your chest, grabs your heart and squeezes tight and doesn’t let go. This book also contains quite a few things that are normally like red flags to me when I'm reading, infidelity to name just one, but the compulsion to carry on with the story completely overcame my normal, set in stone, hang-ups.

I’m making it sound bad and it certainly is very rough round the edges but it’s taut, it’s raw, it’s edgy and it’s incredibly compelling and despite muttering things like ‘He did not just do that’ ‘ No way he just said that to her’, I was fascinated and could not put the damned book down. Underneath the mass of thorns that is the way everyone behaves in this book, there is this beautiful rose blooming and that is the love between Eva and Deuce – it’s a constant throughout the book although you may have to look hard to see it sometimes.

I will say that the editing was not up to par in this book – the typos jumped out at me thick and fast in the first half of the book. They may well have been there in the second half of the book too but, by that point, I was reading so fast I didn’t notice, nor did I actually care!

I’m going to highly recommend this one – it’s slightly reminiscent of Kristen Ashley’s Motorcycle Man but much rougher around the edges and far less rose-tinted.

4 badass stars

Thanks to Zusi for the most awesome rec!

For more reviews, please visit Sinfully Sexy Book Blog

Update 11/29/12 Rating dropped for reasons I'm no longer allowed to say due to GR rule changes. My original review for the book stands in order to comply with GR policy.


Original 3 star review from 10/25/12

Header removed because photobucket is not worth my time anymore. It pretty much said something about me trying to be objective.

I promised that if I read Undeniable, I would be fair and objective as per dictionary.com's definition (adj.) : not influenced by personal feelings, interpretations, or prejudice. Yes, I had a bit of a bias going into this book. Part of me still feels shady about even reading the book, since I wouldn't have done it if Undeniable hadn't been compared to Sons of Anarchy (my favorite t.v. show). But I did cave and read the book, and I now I will give my thoughts.

Warning : There will be some mention of the graphic level of content in this book. I have written a fairly spoiler-free review in terms of plot, but have mentioned certain things that happen in the book which I think people might want to know about before picking it up so they can decide if they want to even read this (such as the mention of rape scenes).

I can easily predict that if this book makes it big, there are two things which will happen in true Twilight, Fifty Shades of Grey, and Beautiful Disaster style :

1. People will go crazy about the book, name it as one of their favorites, and recommend it to everyone they know.
2. People will pick up the book, think it's the biggest piece of sexist, abusive crap, and will write scathing reviews.

So where do I stand? I'm right there in the middle. Because I understand that you can't profile a certain type of lifestyle without showing the gritty underlying truth, I wasn't personally offended by the fact that real-life issues came up in the story such as rape, cheating, degrading of women by calling names, etc. When you're dealing with club life, gang life, crime life, etc. etc. people aren't going to react the way someone living in mainstream society necessarily would. Children are born into a lifestyle, they are raised in it, and they grow up to continue the lifestyle, not always taught that they have other/better options. It's easy to sit back from the outside and scream at the female that she's being idiotic for allowing herself to be used and abused, but we're looking at it from a place of knowing that there are other options.

I have the feeling that Undeniable will be hard for some people who might not find it easy to separate out their world view from someone else's world view. I also have the feeling that there might be people who will fully understand the concept of what is going on and could still rate this book low because some of the content isn't something that they'd want to read about. It's probably safer not to read the book if you know the content won't be your thing, but I don't get to make that decision for anyone else.

For pure story readability, this was an engaging book. It was gritty, dark, violent, sexy, and disturbing. If this were a movie or t.v. show, I'd love every second of it. Not once was I bored. Even when things were happening that I didn't like, I was still fully into what was going on.

As a cohesive book, my thoughts are mixed. There were errors everywhere. Never have I seen such apostrophe abuse - I'm not sure why so many words which needed to be made plural had apostrophes added to them. I also saw incorrect uses of words such as your and you're, as well as plenty of spelling errors.

The excessive amount of swearing and crudeness didn't bother me given the subject matter, but I sort of sighed at how much of the book read like Kristen Ashley dialogue. I don't think there was any sort of copying or anything like that because I completely get that men who live a rougher style are going to speak in a more stilted manner...it was just too close for my comfort level at times.

Final thoughts : Entertaining story that went a little bat-shit crazy at times. I think a few things went round and round to the point where they were beaten to death . If my copy had some editing and a few areas reigned in at times, I might have gone slightly higher on the rating because Undeniable had me sucked into its web.

I'd recommend this to people who can handle controversial subject matter and like it when true bad boys (read : assholes) are reformed. If you're looking for ultra-alpha males and lots of crazy, sexy time, you'll find it with this book. And if you're a SoA fan, just picture Deuce as Jax (hey, he had the shoulder length blonde hair!) and you'll enjoy it that much more. :)
    adult contemporary-romance drama-llama

No, this is not a paranormal book .
MC stands for motorcycle club. Silver Demon and Hell's Horseman are the names of two rival gangs of criminals who go by their on set of rules.

Deuce and Eva
Eva meets the love of her life in a common yet unexpected place on the right day at the right time. FATE. They both have a connection it is in no way, shape or form sexual. It was more like kindred spirits connecting. Through out her life the years pass and they have run in's with one another.

In the end all they have is LOVE.

He filled with primal male satisfaction. She wanted him. Her, a fucking angel in a mess of demons, wanted him, one of the biggest fucking demons he knew. ~Deuce

Thoughts
I loved this book! It was ALPHA MALE HEAVEN! The author kept me on the edge of my seat the whole time. It was everything I needed and wanted in a book. It was raw, intense, edgy and emotional. I could tell the author was unafraid to take risk with her characters and push their limits. As a reader I LOVED that. I found the characters to be very well developed, we felt their emotions and understood their actions. Whether we liked them or not. I fell in love with a lot of the secondary characters too especially Cox and Kami.

THIS STORY WAS CRAZY, MESSED UP AND A LITTLE

BUT I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT!!! (well, almost every minute...)


Undeniable is one hell of a ride that, at times, left me shocked, repulsed, enthralled and fascinated all at once. It was both really beautiful and extremely ugly and raw at the same time. At times I loved it, other times I hated it. All I can say is that the story managed to grasp my attention from the very first page until the very last one... It left me speechless and I don't think I will ever forget it, EVER.

Undeniable is the story of Eva and Deuce, it's not a pretty story, nor is it a happy one but it is THEIR story and to Eva and Deuce that is ALL that matters.

It didn't happen overnight, and it wasn't easy.
Nothing worth doing ever is.
And love is worth everything.

Prologue

Mark Twain said,"The two most important days in your life is the day you were born and the day you find out why."
I don't remember the day I was born, but I remember the day I found out why.
His name was Deuce.
He was my "why."
And this is our story.
It is not a pretty one.

But it's ours.
And because I believe everything happens for a reason, I wouldn't change a thing."
~ Eva


The Story

When Eva and Deuce first meet; she is five years old, he's twenty three. She's the sweet innocent princess of her father's infamous motorcycle club the Silver Demons, he's the sexy bad ass biker of their rival motorcycle club the Hell's Horsemen.

They meet by coincidence while they're both visiting their fathers in the same prison. It was faith that brought them together but as Angel Flonis Hareta said: "There will always be a reason why you meet people. Either you need them to change your life or you're the one that will change theirs."

Eva and Deuce did change each others lives, for better or for worse. From the moment they first meet, Eva was already enchanted by the "charming" biker boy.

Deuce got to his feet grinning and gave me a two-finger salute. "Bye, darlin'."
Darlin'.
It was official. I was head over heels in love.


Deuce, himself was impressed with the little girl too, impressed by her innocence and sweetness and he never managed to get her out of his head ever since...

"Never forget the day she came bouncin' into my fucked-up life, shakin' pigtails, singin' Janis, wearin' Chucks, sharin' peanuts, and straight up stole any decency I had left - which wasn't a whole lot - but she fuckin' took it, and I've been hers ever since."


After that first meeting they don't see each other for several years, but when they meet each other again, the instant connection between them is back. And the fire that sparks between them lights up more and more each time they meet.

There it is, darlin'," he said softly, his lips curving slowly in a sexy grin. "Nothin' like seein' a pretty girl gettin' all fired up. Back of the bike is comin' for ya and soon, too. 'Cause, baby, the way you're lookin' at me is tellin' me you want it. And you want it bad."


Their encounters are filled with love and passion but every single time there is a reason for their meetings to be accompanied by hurt, hatred and betrayal. Not only do other people try to tear them apart, sometimes they tear each other apart as well... Eva learns that Deuce isn't as perfect as she always imagined him to be. Even when they finally can be together, Those scenes made me really mad and I kept thinking: "Why the hell is he so stupid?? If he does that one more time..."

Yes, parts of the story really enraged me. And if you're going to read it be prepared for some ugliness...

"How could a man be so perfect for me and yet so wrong for me all at the same time?"


I often wondered myself that same question about the two of them while reading this story... But in the end they really did love each other and somehow, as crazy as their love for each other was, it all made perfect sense for them to be together...

"Hey," I said softly and cupped his cheeck.
"Yeah?"
"What about your dream?"
His face went dimples. "I'm lookin' at it, darlin"."
Oh. Crap. My heart felt near bursting. I was absolutely done for. This man owned me, body and soul, and everything in between.




"And baby, true freedom is the open road, the wind on your face, and a good woman on the back of your bike, holdin' you tight like you're her reason for breathin', because she sure as fuck is yours."




___________________________________________


Granted, this story was so messed up sometimes, it made me mad and frustrated as hell; but in the end I really loved reading about this crazy-ass couple and their unconditional love for each other... Thinking about everything they've been through and how they still managed to end up the way they did, even brings a tear to my eyes...


So, for everyone who hasn't read this incredible story yet, I would say: prepare yourself for a CRAZY, WILD ride with a lot of swearing, explicit content and some pretty awful, tear-your-heart-out scenes (that involve cheating and raping). This story might not be for everyone but still, I would advice you to read it and find out for yourself...

4 Back of A Bike is Comin’ For Ya Stars ⭐

After reading this book you would understand why it sets the benchmark for MC romances and how it would divide a reading community. Full of triggers and so many gut-wrenching moments, Undeniable is exactly what you should expect from a gritty romance.

“I’m gonna be the club queen ’cause I’m gonna marry the biggest, scariest biker in the whole world, and he’s gonna let me do whatever I want because he’s gonna love me like crazy.”

Toxic love is the foundation for Deuce and Eva's epic relationship. From a young girl smitten with a much older biker of a rival club, it is years of forbidden interludes that carves them into everything they never wanted to be.

You know from their very first, sweetest meeting ever, that this book is going to hurt. They were never meant for the other. But a jaded Deuce recognizes the goodness in Eva, and initially it’s an innocent friendship that spans years; until it isn't. And not even bullet wounds will get Deuce to do the right thing.

Every single one of those men went liquid. She wasn’t just another biker brat; she was the biker brat. The glue that held these men together. Eva Fox was the princess of the Silver Demons MC.

I read this many years ago and I'm impressed that it's withstood the test of time. Before a time when authors second guessed everything they wrote to not offend. This story contains a taboo beginning, cheating, messed up MC members, and too many fuck ups to know that it all matters. It's not meant to be a glossed over, it's meant to be the ugly truth.

Instinctively you recognize that through all the trials and tribulations Eva is the only woman for Deuce. He may be the Prez with prehistoric tendencies, but he underestimated his girl. Unfortunately, it will take him years to realize that the road to forgiveness is long. Read the entire book before you judge because you’ll be pissed from the very beginning!!

4.75-5 Stars

Prologue: Mark Twain said, “The two most important days in your life is the day you were born and the day you find out why.”
I don’t remember the day I was born, but I remember the day I found out why.
His name was Deuce.
He was my “why”.
And this is our story.
It is not a pretty one.
Some parts of it are downright ugly.
But it’s ours.
And because I believe everything happens for a reason, I wouldn’t change a thing.

Holy fucking shit. I fucking devoured this book. DE-fucking-VOURED. I'm sorry for my cussing, but this book is 99% swearing, and tack on the fact I already have a sailor mouth, I'm going to be swearing A LOT. There are a million things I want to say, but I have no idea where to start. I’m lost on words. One thing is for sure is that this is not your typical romance. Not. Even. Fucking. Close. It’s raw, gritty and so fucked up, it will give you whiplash.

**Possible spoilers ahead**

I have to introduce to you to the main cast of characters. You can get a good feel of the story just by knowing who they are.

Eva Fox – Biker brat and daughter of Preacher. The only one who can control Frankie. First met Deuce when she was only five years old and has been smitten with him ever since.
Deuce – President of the Hells Horseman motorcycle club. He’s eighteen years older than Eva. Like all bikers, he is sexy as sin, very Alpha and very possessive. Not very faithful to his women, though.
Frankie - Good looking, pureblooded Italian biker brat who was orphaned when he was only fifteen years old. Preacher took him under his wing when Eva was only twelve. He has a very short fuse, has anger issues and severe abandonment issues. He is prone to night terrors, but finds peace and solace in Eva’s bed (no worries, it remains platonic…at least in the beginning). He is intensely possessive of Eva. He is hugely and insanely jealous of any man coming near her. Will do anything to have her.
Damon Fox (“Preacher”) – President of the infamous “Silver Demon’s” motorcycle club. He is very protective of his daughter and is one dangerous man.
Kami - Eva’s BFF. She’s the daughter of a Senator. She is very promiscuous and lived a very wild life prior to her arranged marriage to Chase. Stuck in a loveless marriage, both Chase and Kami agree to engage in multiple affairs.
Chase Henderson - Highly paid lawyer who graduated from Harvard. Went to prep school with both Kami and Eva. Married to Kami, but has always wanted and loved Eva. Though he is very handsome and smart, he is also a bit of a sleaze and will do whatever it takes to get what he wants.

“So I let you treat me like a piece of fucking furniture who’d be right where you left me every time you decided to grace me with your presence because I promised you I wouldn’t run. But I can’t do it anymore!” ~ Eva

Deuce is Eva’s world. Every small encounter they have is monumental. Just when you think they’ll be together, something always happens to make the other run away. There are tangents all over the place. Multiple lovers, multiple heartaches and just crazy ass, high, intense drama. I’m not really going to go into the plot. There’s just too much going on. Just know that it was no smooth path for Eva and Deuce’s HEA. Far from it.

“Get the fuck off her, mother fucker, before I blow a hole through your fuckin’ skull.” ~ Frankie

My emotions were all over the place in this one. Yes, Deuce and Eva made me crazy, but the character that made me most conflicted is Frankie. If you notice, he’s the one I had to describe the most to. I’m actually disturbed at myself that I felt so much for him. Mentally, he was not all there and to me, he was just an overall sad character. He’s a murderer and just outright psychotic, but the way he died at the end just made me cry. Like Eva, I guiltily had a huge soft spot for him. Yes, call me crazy, but I really couldn’t help it.

Bikers galore in this book, which means lots of testosterone…a whole lot. With them come the women, the money, the cussing, and the fighting. This book held nothing back. There is rape and violence of every sort in this story, so just be warned. As for me, I’m all about fucked up stories. Yes, yes, we already know I’m disturbed, but I think they’re the best kind. They leave a lasting impression, just like this one. Highly recommend!!

I'm trying to calm down now. It's 2:45am, I just finished the book. I think I may either be in shock, or I'm suffering from PTSD. I don't think I'll be able to fall asleep any time soon. I must review this later... I need to process this. Wow.

5 HEART-WRENCHING STARS

Where to begin... first of all I want to say that this was a very good book. It was raw and emotional and actually quite disturbing. The story involves the lives of those born into a subculture of society, the MC or Motorcycle club. It is one thing to choose a lifestyle such as this, involving drugs and alcohol, crime rings, and debauchery. Where men are hard and cruel, and women or bitches (appropriately named) are owned, used and passed around like dirty dishtowels. It is another thing altogether to grow up in this world, knowing no other way of life, where your innocence is practically forfeited at birth. This book is glimpse into one life, and what it was like for a young girl born and raised as the child of the MC.

Eva Fox was 5 years old when she met Cole West. He was twenty-three at the time and known as Deuce to everyone who knew him. Eva was the daughter of Damon Fox, better known as "Preacher," who was the president of the Silver Demon MC and her one and only parent. She was with her Uncle Joe, visiting her father in prison, when she met Deuce. Deuce was 23, and the son of the president of the Horsemen MC. He was there visiting his father, "Reaper" who was also in prison.

Deuce was immediately taken with Eva. She was so sweet and innocent, boucin' around singing Janice Jopplin tunes to herself, and so open and trusting to him and his father. She took to him instantly, holding his hand, and skipping over to meet his old man.

"I am Preacher's little girl. And I'm gonna be just like him when I grow up. I'm gonna have a fatboy but I want mine to be sparkly and I want a pink helmet with skulls on it. And instead of being the club President, I'm gonna be the club Queen cuz I'm gonna marry the biggest, scariest biker in the whole world and he's gonna let me do whatever I want because he's gonna love me like crazy."

Eva ran into Deuce over the years for only brief moments.. but just enough to know, he was the man of her dreams, or so she had decided. But then there was Frankie.

Frankie Deluva came to live with Eva and her Dad at the MC, when his Dad, Frankie Deluva, Sr, Preacher's road chief, died in a auto-accident. Frankie was three years older than Eva, and suffered extreme separation anxiety. He had taken to Eva immediately and was extremely protective of her. In fact, he never left her side. As she started to mature, he made it known that she was to be his girl, and wouldn't even allow her to look sideways at another guy.

Eva had a different plan though... she never forgot about Deuce, and he never forgot about her. Once she hit 16, he was fighting his urges, trying to stay away from her, when he gave in, and crossed the line with her.

"If you were older darlin', I'd have you on the back of my bike and in my fuckin' bed and you'd be not just likin' it but lovin' it, beggin' me for more." ..."Back of my bike is comin' for ya and soon too, cuz baby the way you're lookin' at me is tellin' me you want it. And you want it bad."

Frankie never gave up either. Getting more and more crazy and protective as time went by. But Eva never gave into him. Once Eva finished college, she went gunnin' for Deuce. Little did she know, he was married with kids, livin' in Montana. It didn't stop her though, she still felt they were meant to be together... but things didn't turn out at all like she'd planned.

Life went on... it wasn't kind to her or to Deuce. Frankie was back in the picture, and getting crazier by the day. I will not elaborate on the details of the drama, but just know that life gets ugly. And it is heart-breaking to watch as Eva loses her innocence and her carefree nature. Hardened by the rough life of the MC, she learns to survive and grow strong.

I really fell in love with Eva's character from the very beginning. She was a true innocent, who was brought up in the rough life of the MC. She was loved and cherished by her father and his boys, but was still exposed to their hard and amoral world. Where men were often tough and cruel, and women were disrespected, used and discarded like trash.

I did come to accept many of the characters and their debauchery, but I think I kept wanting to see them grow or redeem themselves in some way. I felt disgusted most of the time, the selfish, indulgent behavior almost reminded me of wild animals instead of people. In fact, I think some species actually treat their females better than these men do theirs.

Deuce pissed me off incessantly!! I don't think I ever thought he deserved Eva's love. There was this spark of good in him, in the beginning, when he was young. A goodness that I felt was drawn to the goodness in Eva... and I kept waiting for it to re-surface when they finally got together.. but it just never came back. I felt he let her down... and after that, I couldn't find enough goodness in him to forgive.



He did find peace at the end... and she got what she wanted.. but the cost was so high!!! The story became so intense in the end... I could not put the book down!!! It was heart-wretching!!! I felt completely drained by the end. And I have to give high praise to the author for this... what a ride it was. Scary and shocking... and so so sad!!! My heart broke at the end of the book!!! And yes..they finally figured it out, what it was that they wanted, and that they had it with each other.

"Whatever this shit is between us its always been there and it's always gonna be there. I'm shit-fuckin'-tired tryin' to ignore it. I'll try to do right by you Eva, you'd be the first, but I'll fuckin' try my damnedest. And baby, true freedom is the open road, the wind on your face and a good woman on the back of your bike holdin' you tight like you're her reason for breathin' because she sure as fuck is yours."
I'm giving this one 5 STARS!!! But read with caution.. this story is not for everyone!!!

Eva Fox "Foxy"



Deuce West



Frankie Deluva
